page.title: 01Laughton Area Summary
page.content: Our area is mostly agricultural with some woodland. The settlements are small villages with closely knit communities. The majority of people were born in the area but increasingly more newcomers are arriving. People from large cities in the vicinity, particularly Sheffield find the area attractive because of its rural nature and lower rates. Entertainment is not very sophisticated, consisting mainly of pubs, dancing clubs, bingo, sports clubs and riding. The area is rich in history with many old churches and a 12th century abbey. Farming is important and there is a farm museum. On the whole this is a pleasant rural area with attractive villages. The landscape is made more attractive by the large amounts of mature deciduous trees, often growing in stream-bottomed valleys.
